div.ab: c_170v_12In the year fifteen hundred seventy-eight, the second of July, the heirs of the late Sieur Ouvryerc_170v_13 received (two hundred and five écus), the rent of Saint-Frajouc_170v_14, amounting to twelve hundred and thirty livres.
They have also received, as part of the revenue of the year fifteen hundred seventy nine, three hundred forty three and one third écus.

And for the first year, to them remains eighty livres and fifteen fig_p170v_2https://drive.google.com/open?id=1MayV4ZIaGElXC-ztkjtbKF9pZw6sTZle,c_170v_02 and for the second settlement, they have not yet received anything.

Take, against pestilential fever or poison or plague, an écu’s weight of your opiate soaked in scabiousc_170v_15 or bugloss water, or thoroughly tempered wine, if one is afflicted. After taking it, one needs to make oneself sweat.

div.ab: Vinegar made from rue juniper berries crushed together. With this vinegar red-hot bricks shall be extinguished and the vapor shall be received through the mouth & nostrilsc_170v_16. This is to preserve oneself when one goes into corrupt airc_170v_17: a garment can be thus perfumed & its infection removed infectionc_170v_18 from it, from a room, house, &c. If you find yourself in a place where you do not have this preparation, carry ruec_170v_19 & berries pestled together, then, according to your need, boil them in vinegar and use as above.
